info.title: Dell Commerce Platform Quote Editor WebApi

get.summary: Returns a single quote resource for the specified id.
get.description: Note: Quote validation is not performed and validations are not returned unless requested by setting the "validate" query string to "true"

parameters.name: quoteId
parameters.description: The globally unique identifier of the quote resource.

parameters.name: validate
parameters.description: When true, this will invoke quote validation logic and return the validations for the quote resource. *NOTE: This can be a very expensive call so only set this to true when you need to validate a quote.

parameters.name: severity
parameters.description: Comma delimited serverities can be passed. Available severities are Info, Warning, Alert, Error, Exception

200.description: OK

patch.summary: Partially updates a specified quote resource.
patch.description:
Only direct quote properties (not child objects) can be updated currently. Only properties specified in the request will be processed while all other properties not specified in the request will be ignored.
NOTE: Null values will be ignored, therefore, to remove a value, you must set the value to an empty string or array.

Response Remarks
  • 204 - Indicates that the request has been sucessfully processed and the response has been intentionally left blank.

parameters.name: quoteId
parameters.description: The globally unique identifier of the quote resource.

parameters.name: quote
parameters.description: {Dell.Quote.Editor.WebApi.Models.PatchQuote.PatchDellQuoteModel}

parameters.name: filter.linkToQuoteId
parameters.description:
When specified, the request will attempt to find the quote id specified for LinkToQuoteId and
                set the LinkId for quote being updated to the LinkId for the quote that is found. If the quote
                assocaited to LinkToQuoteId is not found then no linking will occur. If LinkToQuoteId was found
                but no LinkId exists on that quote then a LinkId will be automatically specified and associated
                to both quotes.

parameters.name: filter.canSkipItemServiceValidation
parameters.description:
This flags instructs Quote Service to skip item validation if/when item validation would normally be called.
Usage: Currently the only time this flag is used when transitioning a quote to quoted status

400.description: Model state is not valid. See response body for details. Also, returned when both LinkToQuoteId querystring was specified and LinkId in body was specified.

$schema.description:
Versioned schema URL that uniquely identifies the quote document
                format.

name.description:
Returns an optional quote name; typically user provided (ex.
                'Birthday Presents').

status.description:
Returns the quote status indicating the merchant's level of
                commitment. Some actions are valid only on specific quote statuss.

createdOn.description: Date the quote object was created.

lastModifiedOn.description: Date the quote object was last modified by the owner.

expiresOn.description: Date the quote will become invalid and no longer binding.

retentionDays.description: Time period, in days, to retain the quote after it has expired.

currencyCode.description:
Returns the ISO 4217 currency code for all prices contained in the
                quote.
                <seealso href="http://www.currency-iso.org" />

items.description: Returns a collection of QuoteItem objects.

shipments.description: Returns a collection of Shipment objects.

properties.description:
Shared collection of literal values or links to external entities.
                Each property must have a unique string key that can be used to
                retrieve on optional string value.

customSkuPricing.description: Flag that marks the quote as a custom pricing quote

references.description: List of causal relationships between the quote and external entities (ex. orders, external quote systems).

promotions.description: promotion exclusion list mapped price request dnc exclusions

solutionRegion.description: Allowed values are AMER, LA, CA, EURO, ASIA

fulfillmentsLookupId.description: Used to look up fulfillments by GET /v1/quotes/fulfillmentUnits/{id}

bypassSplittingRules.description: Set this flag to true only when Splitting logic needs to be Bypass on Quote (before Quoted status)

legacyQuoteId.description:
Legacy quote id is to update the doms quote no (which is 9 digits) 
            9 Digit quote is a DOMS quote (V1 version quote) when it is retrieved thru
            DCP-Quote Gateway the legacy/DOMS quote will be transformed to V2 (OLR quote)
            the quote no.would be changed to 13 digits. From V2 (OLR quote Order Group Schema)
            to DellQuote format. This property will be retained till the V1 and V2 are alive

id.description: Price Adjustment Id. DCPQO authors this Id. Do not create/change.

isTaxInclusive.description:
True or False. Lets say you have a $1000 item and apply $100 discount – and set to true – and tax rate is 10% - then discount is 90$ and 10$ is tax.
            If false the entire $100 is manual discount.

value.description: A valid decimal value indicating $ value or % value

type.description:
Type is one of 3 options: Amount, Percentage and TargetAmount
            Amount is a $ discount
            Percentage is a % discount of the targeted price
            TargetAmount is the adjustment/replacement to the targeted price

scope.description:
Scope is one of two possible options: Local or Global. 
            This dictates how discounts gets applied with existing discounts in place. 
            Let’s say the respective target already has discount of 100$. If you say Scope is Local then apply discount of $150 – total discount will be $250. 
            If you say its global and apply discount of $150 – then it changes total discount to $150.

targetLevel.description:
Target Level should be one of the five options. No more than 1 adjustment can be provided against 
            the same TargetLevel and TargetId
            TargetLevel.AllItems - AllItems under the group/shipment
            TargetLevel.Item - Item level adjustment
            TargetLevel.AllShipments - Quote level shipments
            TargetLevel.Shipment - Shipment adjustment for Shipping charges
            TargetLevel.ShipmentItem - ShipmentItem level adjustment

targetId.description:
This is the Target Id corresponding to the TargetLevel. Use the following guidance:
            For TargetLevel.AllItems (Group) provide the Shipment Id
            For TargetLevel.Item provide Item.OpenBasketItemId
            For TargetLevel.AllShipments provide Quote.Id
            For TargetLevel.Shipment provide Shipment.Id
            For TargetLevel.ShipmentItem provide ShipmentItem.ProductId

parentConfigItemIdHashCode.description:

Dell.Quote.Editor.WebApi.Models.PatchQuo.description: WebApi model used to submit PATCH Quote requests.

linkToQuoteId.description:
When specified, the request will attempt to find the quote id specified for LinkToQuoteId and
                set the LinkId for quote being updated to the LinkId for the quote that is found. If the quote
                assocaited to LinkToQuoteId is not found then no linking will occur. If LinkToQuoteId was found
                but no LinkId exists on that quote then a LinkId will be automatically specified and associated
                to both quotes.

canSkipItemServiceValidation.description:
This flags instructs Quote Service to skip item validation if/when item validation would normally be called.
Usage: Currently the only time this flag is used when transitioning a quote to quoted status

            TargetAmount is the adjustment/replacement to the targeted price

scope.description:
Scope is one of two possible options: Local or Global. 
            This dictates how discounts gets applied with existing discounts in place. 
            Let’s say the respective target already has discount of 100$. If you say Scope is Local then apply discount of $150 – total discount will be $250. 
            If you say its global and apply discount of $150 – then it changes total discount to $150.

targetLevel.description:
Target Level should be one of the five options. No more than 1 adjustment can be provided against 
            the same TargetLevel and TargetId
            TargetLevel.AllItems - AllItems under the group/shipment
            TargetLevel.Item - Item level adjustment
            TargetLevel.AllShipments - Quote level shipments
            TargetLevel.Shipment - Shipment adjustment for Shipping charges
            TargetLevel.ShipmentItem - ShipmentItem level adjustment

targetId.description:
This is the Target Id corresponding to the TargetLevel. Use the following guidance:
            For TargetLevel.AllItems (Group) provide the Shipment Id
            For TargetLevel.Item provide Item.OpenBasketItemId
            For TargetLevel.AllShipments provide Quote.Id
            For TargetLevel.Shipment provide Shipment.Id
            For TargetLevel.ShipmentItem provide ShipmentItem.ProductId

linkToQuoteId.description:
When specified, the request will attempt to find the quote id specified for LinkToQuoteId and
                set the LinkId for quote being updated to the LinkId for the quote that is found. If the quote
                assocaited to LinkToQuoteId is not found then no linking will occur. If LinkToQuoteId was found
                but no LinkId exists on that quote then a LinkId will be automatically specified and associated
                to both quotes.

$schema.description:
Versioned schema URL that uniquely identifies the quote document
                format.

id.description: Returns the quote's durable and globally unique identifier.

name.description:
Returns an optional quote name; typically user provided (ex.
                'Birthday Presents').

status.description:
Returns the quote status indicating the merchant's level of
                commitment. Some actions are valid only on specific quote statuss.

createdOn.description: Date the quote object was created.

lastModifiedOn.description: Date the quote object was last modified by the owner.

expiresOn.description: Date the quote will become invalid and no longer binding.

retentionDays.description: Time period, in days, to retain the quote after it has expired.

currencyCode.description:
Returns the ISO 4217 currency code for all prices contained in the
                quote.
                <seealso href="http://www.currency-iso.org" />

items.description: Returns a collection of QuoteItem objects.

shipments.description: Returns a collection of Shipment objects.

properties.description:
Shared collection of literal values or links to external entities.
                Each property must have a unique string key that can be used to
                retrieve on optional string value.

customSkuPricing.description: Flag that marks the quote as a custom pricing quote

references.description: List of causal relationships between the quote and external entities (ex. orders, external quote systems).

promotions.description: promotion exclusion list mapped price request dnc exclusions

solutionRegion.description: Allowed values are AMER, LA, CA, EURO, ASIA

fulfillmentsLookupId.description: Used to look up fulfillments by GET /v1/quotes/fulfillmentUnits/{id}

bypassSplittingRules.description: Set this flag to true only when Splitting logic needs to be Bypass on Quote (before Quoted status)

legacyQuoteId.description:
Legacy quote id is to update the doms quote no (which is 9 digits) 
            9 Digit quote is a DOMS quote (V1 version quote) when it is retrieved thru
            DCP-Quote Gateway the legacy/DOMS quote will be transformed to V2 (OLR quote)
            the quote no.would be changed to 13 digits. From V2 (OLR quote Order Group Schema)
            to DellQuote format. This property will be retained till the V1 and V2 are alive
